page.title: 13School Cycle Training.
page.content: The narrow roads and large numbers of parked cars in Banbury's Bretch Hill area makes this one of Oxfordshires accident black spots. To help make the older primary children safer on their bicycles before they go to secondary school, a great deal of training goes into making them aware of the dangers on the road. They are taught to control and ride their bikes properly and how to negotiate traffic and junctions. Whilst they are on the road they wear yellow safety jackets and are under the constant supervision of two teachers. In the classroom they are taught the rules of road safety and to recognise traffic signals and signs. Generally by the end of the course most children pass the practical test given to them by a Road Safety Officer or a local policeman.
